column4: if anyone could advice me on this seemingly simple error (on my part), it would be much appreciated. I uploaded the text to a webpage so I don't clutter the channel: http://www.freewebs.com/ryanazar/please_help.html
if anyone can suggest a place for me to go to get help, i would be happy to go elsewhere.
i do not want to disturb others, i just need help for my question :X
i am guessing this isn't the place to get help, I appologize.

I am trying to compile a simple program and gcc is giving me a few errors, i set up a small log showing what gcc spit out and what command i used here: http://www.freewebs.com/ryanazar/please_help.html
haha... libx11-dev is the way to go
but i have the header files in the folder, is that not correct?
in addition, i just checked synaptic and it says libx11-dev is installed.
and the header file is in the same folder as what you are compiling
they are copies. i put them in there because i kept getting that error when i tried to build. the real files are in /usr/X11R6/include/X11/
I am not sure then. You'll have to ask someone that knows a little more about c
